intro: Hydrolea paraguayensis var. inermis, commonly known as the Paraguay hydrolea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil and Paraguay, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
